data.title: Really Excellent Farm to Table Restaurant
data.text: Not sure where some of these negative reviews of Epiphany Cafe are coming from?  I just had my 2nd excellent meal at Epiphany last week while visiting Tuscaloosa.  I love the concept of farm to table and Epiphany really does this well.  The menu is very descriptive as to what the food item is, how it is prepared and what other ingredients are prepared with the item.  There is a large chalkboard in the main room listing the farms and dairies where the foods are sourced from.  Almost all are local and from Alabama.  And if this isn't enough the wait staff is well educated on the menu items and can answer any questions one has about the items offered that evening.  I could go into all the fresh offerings on the menu or the fantastic wine list or the craft beer selections available, but trust me when I say that this is a fantastic restaurant unlike most restaurants you will find in a town the size of Tuscaloosa.  It is a small plate restaurant and the offerings are meant to be shared like at a tapas restaurant.  It's a very novel concept.  I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in Tuscaloosa.

data.title: Here's an ephiphany... it's a disappointment
data.text: Although the concept is great, the puny portions and pretentious prices make it one of the most disappointing experiences ever.  We went out to eat after our expensive meals and ate normal portions of barbeque just to feel satisfied.

data.title: Lots of potential
data.text: We really liked the concept.  The wine list wasn't long, but it included good choices.  The brussel sprouts were delicious as were some of the other dishes.  The service was friendly but inconsistent.  We would give it another try.

data.title: Explosion of Flavor with every new bite
data.text: Farm to Fork themed restaurant. Every flavor was very detailed and superb. Atmosphere was friendly, relax, nice or casual. It was delicious. Top 3 restaurants I've ever been to (I travel and eat locally, often).  It was worth the price. Ask Ally, the bartender, for recommendations. She was accurate on every choice. Love, love, love!!!

data.title: Fine Dining
data.text: Great atmosphere and excellent food. Romantic and a great place for special occasions.  Easy access and a must for everyone in this area

data.title: Extraordinary food! Ignore the decor....
data.text: This restaurant is an amazing hidden jewel. They call themselves "farm to fork" and all of the food is locally sourced. The combination of flavors is unusual without being overly fussy or in any way pretentious. Local produce, meat, fowl and fish are combined with herbs and sometimes a hint of an exotic twist ( like coconut milk in the rice pudding) This is a really really special restaurant. Only problem, and you must overlook this, is that it's not particularly pretty. Housed in what looks like an old college bar, it's "woody"and a little worn out looking. However the food is superb! Close your eyes and feast away!

data.title: Fun night
data.text:
A most enjoyable evening.  Tried the brussels sprouts, hot chicken, short ribs, scallops and spaghetti squash dishes.  All were very good.  Server Tom explained the dishes in detail.  Our dining companions enjoyed the meal even though one hates vegetables and the other is not an adventurous eater.  Both of them loved the brussels and squash.  

Only critical comment is the chicken breading was soft and mushy under the crust.

Overall good experience and we will return.

data.title: Looking for Farm to Table
data.text: Awesome food. Recommend the Brussel Sprouts and Kim Chi. Tasty wine and great service. Casual dinning atmosphere.

data.title: Beet Cremeaux, Yes Please!
data.text: The Beet Cremeaux is probably one of the best desserts I've ever tasted. The look is so curious and unique. One bite and you are hooked! The menu changes pretty frequently which is probably what makes the experience unique to the area. There is usually a variety of vegan and meat choices (beef, chicken, pork, and seafood) that will satisfy a variety of palettes. My husband and I usually split two plates and a dessert. When I have visited with a larger group, the general rule is to order a plate a person. That provides ample opportunity to try different dishes. As far as atmosphere, it has never been too loud for intimate conversation even with the restaurant being full.

data.title: Horrible food.
data.text: They try to get too earthy and fancy with the food. Not a traditional restaurant and menu, which isn't always a good thing.  Service was average at best, did not do a good job of describing how the food is prepared and presented.  Food was horrible. My wife took about 3 bites of her salad and pushed away.  I'll eat almost anything so I did finish mine, but struggled to get through it.  Will never go back.

data.title: DATE Night
data.text: Nice quiet restaurant for a good date night away from life struggles.  Farm to table menus offers lots of choices and good tastes.

data.title: Farm to table goodness!
data.text:
Traveling a long distance (from Indiana) means trying to find the local restaurant that serves unique offerings with outstanding taste. Epiphany did just that! Their farm to table menu was outstanding, featuring small plates highlighting fresh, locally grown or raised ingredients, and pairing some interesting foods together to make your meal a very special experience.
Anthony, our server and food guide, was one of the best servers I have ever met as his knowledge of both the chefs preferences and the menu itself were unequalled anywhere. He truly was someone who loves what he does!
It will be a designated stop on each future visit to Tuscaloosa!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I ate dinner here with a group of girlfriends recently, and we had a great time sampling lots of different dishes.  Instead of ordering our own plates, we decided to split three small plates + bread service, two large plates, and two desserts.  We all agreed that the short ribs and the chocolate mousse cake were our favorites, but the fried chicken was a close second.  The food came out quickly, was plated beautifully, and tasted delicious.  Our only minor complaint was that our main server seemed to dislike us... a lot.  She must have been having a bad day because she appeared irritated to have to wait on us and frequently rolled her eyes or shook her head when leaving our table.  Her service as far as refilling drinks, etc., was all fine, but her demeanor and attitude made us all uncomfortable.  I was surprised to have a service experience like that because in the past one of my favorite things about Epiphany has been the friendly, welcoming service.  I will go back to Epiphany many times, but if I am seated in this particular woman's section I may ask to be moved.

data.title: Delicious
data.text:
Had not eaten here in a decade.
Our daughter wanted to go on her 23rd birthday. We were skeptical. Ordered and shared several small plates. All wonderful.
 The hot chicken, eggplant meatballs, gnocchi and the Brussels sprouts were all excellent. BY FAR the best restaurant in Tuscaloosa.

data.title: No Epiphany
data.text:
We ate here 8/16/16 and the wines are very expensive. House Merlot $11.00 /serving, house Cabernet $9.00. The servings were sized like tapas and recommended to choose 3. My wife's zucchini meatballs were too spicy hot to eat. Melon soup ($10.00) was good. Our meal cost $61.00. 
I wold not recommend or return.

data.title: Friendly casual restaurant with tasty fresh food
data.text:
If you love no frills restaurants with friendly service and freshly prepared good quality food - this is for you.
We went on a busy night but still received an excellent experience.

Brussell Sprout dish was best we've had

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: Came to Epiphany because of the location and the tripadvisor ratings. It did not disappoint. Superb menu. Difficult to decide what to eat because of all the options. We went with the slow cooked lamb and the beef ribs. Also had the house made ricotta gnocchi and  red chili biscuits. All were mmmmmm yummy good. The service was top notch. Anthony went above and beyond to describe each dish in detail and even allowed us to sample wines he highly recommended. I think the restaurant decor could use a little TLC but that's my only complaint. Would definitely go back when visiting the area again

data.title: Thoughtfully sourced and prepared food
data.text: Had a business dinner here and everyone enjoyed the food. Cafe serves small plates and suggests 2 per person. Choices were intriguing and tasty. My only small complaint were prices- for exampke desserts were $10 but would recommend.

data.title: Tasty and different
data.text:
We had a very helpful and friendly waiter, Anthony who was delightful and sharp.
This restaurant is for special occasions, a romantic dinner or for those who love spoiling them selves with interesting food when they go out and don't want the normal boring menu. 
We had the Brussels Sprouts which was out of this world and highly recommended!  As well as the shaven scallops which I didn't taste but my partner enjoyed it! We found the short rib belini too salty but I believe that could be great if it isn't that salty

They also have French Press coffee which was a total bonus because good coffee in  America you find few and far between.
We will definitely eat there again in the near future!

data.title: Surprising menu
data.text: This is a good restaurant. The menu is a little surprising and the combination of tastes and colors is interesting and nice. Small plates are available and service is good.
